metadata.name: Browser Tools for Claude Code
metadata.description: Complete re-write of AgentDesk's sophisticated Browser Tools MCP server for AI agents

javascript-modules.reason: Native Node.js ES modules - immediate compatibility

forbidden-formats.reason: Causes import issues, requires build step

project-overview.purpose: Complete re-write of AgentDesk's Browser Tools MCP server to optimise browser-testing and front-end development with AI agents - now updated to June 2025 MCP specification

goals.goal: Fix 4 broken browser tools (browser_evaluate, browser_get_content, browser_audit, browser_get_console)
Maintain 5 working tools (browser_navigate, browser_screenshot, browser_click, browser_type, browser_wait)
Enhance UI responsiveness with modular components and real-time status indicators
Optimize WebSocket communication and eliminate timeout issues

constraints.constraint: Must maintain compatibility with existing AgentDesk Chrome extension
Must support port 3024 for Claude Code MCP integration
Must implement security validation for all browser operations
Must handle headless browser operations without interfering with user

success-metrics.metric: Integration tests passing for all tools (100%)
Performance benchmarks within acceptable limits (<5s per operation)

communication-flow.step: MCP Server ‚Üî HTTP Bridge (HTTP on port 3024)
Chrome Extension ‚Üî Browser APIs (Chrome DevTools Protocol)

contract.name: IBrowserTool
contract.description: Standard interface for all browser tools

contract.name: IWebSocketHandler
contract.description: WebSocket communication interface for Chrome extension

gate.name: interface-compliance
gate.description: All tools must implement IBrowserTool interface

gate.name: chrome-extension-validation
gate.description: Chrome extension manifest and permissions validation

known-issues.issue: Timeout errors during JavaScript execution - requires security sandbox implementation
Request timeout issues - WebSocket communication optimization needed
Returns HTML instead of JSON (parsing error) - Lighthouse integration fix required
Request timeout - Console monitoring implementation needs debugging
Occasional timeout during capture - WebSocket optimization needed
"Unknown message type" errors - Message format validation needed

decision.title: MCP Protocol Version
decision.context: Need to ensure compatibility with Claude Code's latest MCP implementation
decision.decision: Use MCP protocol version "2025-06-18" for full compliance

consequences.consequence: All existing code must be updated to new protocol format
Enables integration with latest Claude Code features

decision.title: MANE Deployment Model
decision.context: Need efficient parallel agent development for fixing broken tools
decision.decision: Use MANE-Worktrees for isolated agent development

consequences.consequence: Each agent works in isolated universe
Parallel development of all 4 broken tools

batch.description: Core tools implemented but need debugging
Advanced tools broken and require significant debugging

capabilities.capability: Interface contract definition (IBrowserTool, IWebSocketHandler)
Registry system implementation for auto-discovery
Base class library creation for tool inheritance
Quality gates pipeline establishment
MCP protocol compliance framework

steps.step: Agent commits work to dedicated branch
Agent pushes branch to remote repository
Agent creates Pull Request with detailed description
Agent STOPS and prompts user to merge PR before proceeding
User manually merges PR to integrate foundation changes
Next batch agents' worktrees MUST be created AFTER merge
New worktrees inherit merged foundation code automatically

mandatory-user-workflow.halt-condition: PR merge required before creating next batch worktrees
mandatory-user-workflow.user-prompt-template:
üö® **CRITICAL: USER ACTION REQUIRED**
Agent {agent-name} has completed {batch-name} work and created PR #{pr-number}.
**MANDATORY WORKFLOW:** 1. ‚úÖ Code committed to `{branch-name}` branch 2. ‚úÖ Branch pushed to remote repository 3. ‚úÖ Pull Request created: {pr-url} 4. ‚è≥ **USER MUST MERGE PR BEFORE PROCEEDING**
**Why this is critical:** - Foundation work MUST be merged before other agents can build on it - Next batch worktrees must be created AFTER merge to inherit foundation - Ensures proper dependency chain and code inheritance - Prevents integration conflicts and broken agent development
**Next Steps:** 1. Review PR: {pr-url} 2. Merge PR to main branch 3. Confirm merge completion 4. **THEN create new worktrees for next batch** (they will inherit merged code) 5. Deploy next batch agents on updated foundation
**‚ö†Ô∏è DO NOT CREATE NEXT BATCH WORKTREES UNTIL PR IS MERGED ‚ö†Ô∏è**

responsibilities.responsibility: Establish base classes for tool inheritance

capabilities.capability: UI component modularization and responsive design
Real-time status indicators and progress visualization
Configuration panel enhancement and user experience
WebSocket communication status display

steps.step: Agent commits work to dedicated branch
Agent pushes branch to remote repository
Agent creates Pull Request with detailed description
Agent STOPS and prompts user to merge PR before proceeding
User manually merges PR to integrate framework changes
Next batch agents' worktrees MUST be created AFTER merge
New worktrees inherit merged foundation and framework code

mandatory-user-workflow.halt-condition: PR merge required before creating next batch worktrees
mandatory-user-workflow.user-prompt-template:
üö® **CRITICAL: USER ACTION REQUIRED**
Agent {agent-name} has completed {batch-name} work and created PR #{pr-number}.
**MANDATORY WORKFLOW:** 1. ‚úÖ Code committed to `{branch-name}` branch 2. ‚úÖ Branch pushed to remote repository 3. ‚úÖ Pull Request created: {pr-url} 4. ‚è≥ **USER MUST MERGE PR BEFORE PROCEEDING**
**Why this is critical:** - Framework work MUST be merged before core tools agents can build on it - Next batch worktrees must be created AFTER merge to inherit foundation + framework - Ensures proper dependency chain and code inheritance - Prevents integration conflicts and broken agent development
**Next Steps:** 1. Review PR: {pr-url} 2. Merge PR to main branch 3. Confirm merge completion 4. **THEN create new worktrees for next batch** (they will inherit merged code) 5. Deploy next batch agents on updated foundation + framework
**‚ö†Ô∏è DO NOT CREATE NEXT BATCH WORKTREES UNTIL PR IS MERGED ‚ö†Ô∏è**

responsibilities.responsibility: Modularize existing UI components for reusability
Enhance responsive design and visual polish

tool.name: browser_navigate
tool.description: Navigate browser to specified URLs with security validation

features.feature: Security protocol filtering (blocks file:, chrome:, data: URLs)

capabilities.capability: URL validation and normalization with security checks
Navigation timeout handling with AbortController
Security protocol filtering to prevent dangerous navigation
Real-time navigation status updates in UI
Comprehensive error handling and logging

features.feature: Smart filename generation based on page content

capabilities.capability: Full page and element-specific screenshot capture

WebSocket communication for real-time capture coordination
Error handling and user feedback for capture operations

metadata.description: Core infrastructure and architectural foundation for MANE system

feature.name: Interface Contracts
feature.description: Define standard interfaces for all browser tools (IBrowserTool, IWebSocketHandler)

feature.name: Registry System
feature.description: Auto-discovery and registration system for zero-coordination development

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Zero manual coordination required between agents

feature.name: Quality Gates Pipeline
feature.description: Automated quality validation and compliance checking

deliverables.deliverable: Base class library for tool inheritance

metadata.description: UI framework and component system enhancement for better user experience

feature.name: UI Component Modularization
feature.description: Break UI into modular, reusable components for independent development

feature.name: Responsive Design Enhancement
feature.description: Enhance responsive design and visual polish across all screen sizes

feature.name: Real-time Status Indicators
feature.description: Implement real-time status and progress indicators for all operations

metadata.description: Navigation, screenshot, and interaction tools - the foundation of browser automation

feature.name: Navigation Tool
feature.description: Reliable browser navigation with comprehensive security validation

feature.name: Screenshot Tool
feature.description: Intelligent screenshot capture with smart naming and optimization

issues.issue: Timeout optimization needed for large screenshots

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Input field text entry with clear option

parallel-execution.reason: Independent tool implementations with no shared dependencies

metadata.description: JavaScript execution, auditing, console monitoring, content extraction - the power tools

feature.name: JavaScript Execution
feature.description: Secure JavaScript execution in browser context with sandboxing

critical-issues.issue: Timeout errors during execution - security sandbox needed
Error handling incomplete for script failures

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Comprehensive error handling and result serialization

feature.name: Performance Auditing
feature.description: Lighthouse integration for comprehensive performance analysis

critical-issues.issue: Returns HTML instead of JSON (parsing error)

feature.name: Console Monitoring
feature.description: Real-time console log and error monitoring for debugging

critical-issues.issue: Request timeout issues in console monitoring

feature.name: Content Extraction
feature.description: HTML and text content extraction capabilities

critical-issues.issue: Request timeout issues during content extraction

parallel-execution.reason: Independent tool fixes with isolated debugging requirements

phase.name: individual-validation
phase.description: Test each tool individually before batch integration

phase.name: batch-integration
phase.description: Integrate all core tools after individual validation

tool.name: browser_evaluate
tool.reason: Most complex implementation requiring security sandbox

tool.name: browser_get_content
tool.reason: High usage tool for content analysis

strategy.name: registry-based
strategy.description: Use auto-discovery registry for zero-coordination integration

pre-integration-requirements.requirement: All batch agents must commit and push their work
Pull Requests must be created for each agent's work
User must manually merge PRs before next batch deployment
New worktrees must be created AFTER merge completion

strategy.name: validation-first
strategy.description: Test each universe individually before batch integration

strategy.name: smart-merge
strategy.description: AI-driven conflict resolution with intelligent merging

gate.name: interface-compliance
gate.description: Validate all implementations follow IBrowserTool interface contracts

gate.name: test-coverage
gate.description: Ensure minimum test coverage requirements are met

gate.name: websocket-communication
gate.description: WebSocket communication validation and timeout testing

steps.step: Identify failed quality gate
Restore from backup
Analyze failure cause
Fix issue in individual universe
Re-run validation
Restore from backup
Re-run individual universe tests
Identify integration conflict
Apply smart-merge strategy
Validate merged result
